articles.title: Statistical Experimental Design
articles.contents:
Contents
Readings
Lectures

The official syllabus, which gives requirements, learning objectives, and grading mechanisms, is available here. This website only includes links to the reading and lecture content – the course structure is mapped out fully on the Canvas homepage.
Readings
Readings refer to the 10th edition1 of Design and Analysis of Experiments by Douglas Montgomery.
Week
Topic
Reading
1 
Basic principles & examples
1.1 - 1.4
2 
Sampling distributions, difference in means, pairing
2.1 - 2.5
3 
ANOVA, model checking, multiple comparisons
3.1 - 3.5
4 
Computer examples, random effects, nonparametric approaches
3.6 - 3.11 (except 3.10)
5 
Randomized complete block design, Latin Squares design
4.1 - 4.3
6 
Balanced incomplete block designs, and Factorial Design Intro
4.4.1, 5.1 - 5.2
7 
Two and general factorial design, intro to response curves
5.3 - 5.5
8 
Intro to \(2^k\) designs
6.1 - 6.4
9 
Examples of \(2^k\) designs
6.5 - 6.6
10 
Properties of \(2^k\) designs, fractional factorial designs
6.7 - 6.9, 8.1 - 8.2
11 
More fractional factorial designs
8.3 - 8.7 (except 8.5)
12 
Response surfaces
11.1 - 11.4.2
13 
More response surfaces
11.4.3 - 11.6
14 
Nested and split plot designs
14.1 - 14.4
Lectures
Notes are listed here. Source code and links to recorded videos are listed at the top of each set of lecture notes.

You may use any edition in this course. For reference, here is the 10th edition’s table of contents.↩︎
